intro: Hippocrepis liouvillei, commonly known as the Liouville's bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Boraginaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in rocky or gravelly soils. The plant produces showy blue or violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It has a compact growth habit with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is often cultivated in gardens and conservation efforts.
